page.title: 09INTERVIEW WITH A VILLAGER
page.content: Mr. Stickland was born at Reperry in the parish of Lanivet in{1900.}He went to school at Lanivet and had a rough time.There were about 115 children then. As there were no school dinners he had to go home.The Green was wet, boggy land with rushes. He said that when girls were naughty they had a slap across the legs, boys were given the cane.He had to ride a bike to school and had to go to church and Sunday School. Mr. Stickland's first car was a 'bull-nosed'Morris. He can remember the first aeroplane landing at St. Mawgan near Newquay and a lady fainted! He worked horses on his farm (his father was a tenant farmer) and rode to Liskeard Market every time it was on.
